<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>arma</value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.08</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> GUI Control - ListBox </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sorts the ListBox entries by [[lbValue]]. The entries are sorted in ascending order. Also note that this command will mix up the entries randomly if multiple entries have the same value. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''lbSortByValue''' control </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> control: [[Control]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name> s2</name>=<value> '''lbSortByValue''' idc &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; (''since Arma 3 v1.67'') </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> idc: [[Number]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name> r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[lbSortByValue]] _control;</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[lbSortByValue]] 101;</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[lbSort]], [[lnbSort]], [[tvSort]], [[tvSortByValue]], [[lnbSortByValue]], [[lbAdd]], [[lbClear]], [[lbColor]], [[lbCurSel]], [[lbData]], [[lbDelete]], [[lbIsSelected]], [[lbPicture]], [[lbSelection]], [[lbSetColor]], [[lbSetCurSel]], [[lbSetData]], [[lbSetPicture]], [[lbSetSelected]], [[lbSetTooltip]], [[lbSetValue]], [[lbSize]], [[lbSort]], [[lbText]], [[lbValue]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">January 1st, 2011 - 22:54
<dt class="note">[[User:roehre|Roehre]]
<dd class="note">
A good way to avoid that this Command will mix your Listbox up is, to assign your Value summed up with the Index ID returned by [[lbAdd]] to your Listbox Entries. 
<dd class="notedate">Posted: Sep 10 2014</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:ffur2007slx2_5|ffur2007slx2_5]]</dt>
<dd class="note">More information on the LB command family can be found [[List_Box|here]]
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
